item.title: 工会发出罢工通知，加拿大铁路再陷瘫痪
item.description: 周五，就在火车重新开始运行几小时后，一个工会对加拿大最大的铁路公司发出罢工通知，这很可能会破坏重振重要航运网络的计划。【原文：A union filed strike notice against Canada’s largest railway on Friday just hours after trains began rolling again, likely derailing plans to revive vital shipping networks.】

item.title: 欧洲央行雷恩称通货紧缩和经济疲软是 9 月减息的后盾
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员奥利-雷恩（Olli Rehn）表示，通胀放缓和欧元区经济疲软增强了下月降低借贷成本的理由。【原文：The slowdown in inflation alongside weakness in the euro-zone economy strengthen arguments to lower borrowing costs next month, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Olli Rehn.】

item.title: 迈克-阿什利的女儿被任命为英国零售帝国总监
item.description: 迈克-阿什利（Mike Ashley）的一个女儿被任命为这位英国亿万富翁零售帝国的董事。【原文：One of Mike Ashley’s daughters has been appointed a director of the British billionaire’s retail empire.】

item.title: 开普敦获得国际金融公司 1.58 亿美元贷款用于基础设施建设
item.description: 南非开普敦市从世界银行私人投资部门获得了一笔 28 亿兰特（1.58 亿美元）的贷款，用于改善其供水、卫生和电力道路基础设施。【原文：South Africa’s City of Cape Town secured a 2.8 billion-rand ($158 million) loan from the World Bank’s private-investment arm to boost its water, sanitation, power road infrastructure.】

item.title: 通胀放缓，欧洲央行准备下一次降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）官员大谈下个月再次降息的前景，他们将从通胀率正急剧向其目标回落的预测中得到鼓舞。【原文：European Central Bank officials talking up the prospect of another reduction in interest rates next month will take heart from forecasts suggesting inflation is plummeting back toward their target.】

item.title: 鸽派鲍威尔助推美元创 16 个月来最长跌势
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔确认央行将于下月降息的预期后，美元大跌，引发全球主要同业货币反弹。【原文：The dollar plunged after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell affirmed expectations that the central bank will cut interest rates next month, sparking a rally in the currencies of major global peers.】

item.title: 鲍威尔谈降息，全球股市创历史新高
item.description: 随着投资者从美国降息范围和缺乏衰退信号中获得信心，全球股市在收复早些时候动荡造成的损失后将创下历史新高。【原文：Global equities are set to close at an all-time high after recouping losses from the turmoil earlier this, as investors gain confidence from the scope of US interest-rate cuts and the lack of recession signals.】

item.title: 鲍威尔锁定 9 月降息赌局，国债反弹
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在杰克逊霍尔的讲话巩固了央行下月降息的预期，此后国债反弹。【原文：Treasuries rallied after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s speech at Jackson Hole cemented expectations that the central bank will cut interest rates next month.】

item.title: Topgolf 因担心衍生产品 "来得太晚 "而遭双重降级
item.description: Topgolf Callaway Brands Corp.旗下同名高尔夫练习场销售下滑，债务负担沉重，可能会吓跑买家，这促使雷蒙德-詹姆斯（Raymond James）下调了该公司的评级。【原文：Slowing sales at Topgolf Callaway Brands Corp.’s namesake driving ranges and a hefty debt load that threatens to frighten off buyers spurred Raymond James to slash the company’s rating.】

item.title: 欧洲央行森特诺称 9 月降息决定 "轻而易举
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马里奥-森特诺（Mario Centeno）认为，欧洲中央银行下月降息的决定是直截了当的。【原文：The decision for the European Central Bank to lower interest rates next month is straight-forward, according to Governing Council member Mario Centeno.】

item.title: 英镑兑美元创两年多来最强水平
item.description: 英镑兑美元汇率攀升至 2022 年 3 月以来的最高水平，使英国货币今年以来的涨幅再创新高。【原文：Sterling climbed to its highest level since March 2022 against the dollar, adding to the British currency’s peer-beating gains this year.】

item.title: 鲍威尔释放降息信号，黄金扩大涨幅
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔发出降息时机已到的信号后，黄金延续涨势。【原文：Gold extended gains after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled that time has come for interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 鲍威尔称美联储降息 "时机已到
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，美联储下调关键政策利率的时机已经到来，他肯定了官员们将在下个月开始降低借贷成本的预期，并明确表示他有意防止劳动力市场进一步降温。【原文：Chair Jerome Powell said the time has come for the Federal Reserve to cut its key policy rate, affirming expectations that officials will begin lowering borrowing costs next month and making clear his intention to prevent further cooling in the labor market.】

item.title: 阅读鲍威尔在杰克逊霍尔研讨会上的演讲全文
item.description: 以下是美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔周五在怀俄明州杰克逊霍尔发表的题为 "回顾与展望 "的讲话稿的重新格式化版本：【原文：The following is a reformatted version of prepared remarks titled “Review and Outlook,” which Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is delivering Friday in Jackson Hole, Wyoming:】

item.title: 速溶咖啡亲和力让罗布斯塔咖啡豆从 "后辈 "成为宠儿
item.description: 全世界对速溶咖啡的喜爱与日俱增，这使得咖啡烘焙商不得不继续依赖曾被咖啡爱好者冷落的罗布斯塔品种，即使价格达到了约半个世纪以来的最高点。【原文：The world’s growing love for instant coffee is keeping roasters reliant on the robusta variety once snubbed by java snobs, even as prices reach the highest in about half a century.】

item.title: 秘鲁锌矿商火山矿业公司称 81% 的债券已投标兑换
item.description: 最近被阿根廷集团 Integra Capital 收购的秘鲁锌矿商 Volcan Cia Minera 称，债券持有人已将现有 2026 年票据的 81% 兑换成四年后到期的票据。【原文：Volcan Cia Minera, the Peruvian zinc miner that was recently acquired by Argentine group Integra Capital, said bondholders had tendered 81% of existing 2026 notes to be exchanged for ones maturing four years later.】

item.title: 马克龙在挑选新总理前会见法国各党领袖
item.description: 埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）与法国各政党领导人举行了一系列会议，因为总统准备任命新总理，并结束数周以来因临时选举导致议会悬而未决的不确定性。【原文：Emmanuel Macron kicked off a series of meetings with French political party leaders as the president prepares to name a new prime minister and end weeks of uncertainty after snap elections delivered a hung parliament.】

item.title: 孟加拉国寻求国际货币基金组织 30 亿美元紧急援助以帮助偿还债务
item.description: 孟加拉国新任央行行长表示，该国正寻求从国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）增资 30 亿美元，以从近期的政治动荡中恢复过来，并正从当地银行购买美元以偿还未偿债务。【原文：Bangladesh’s new central bank governor said the country is seeking an additional $3 billion from the International Monetary Fund as it looks to recover from recent political turmoil, and is buying dollars from local banks to meet unpaid debt.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利的威尔逊称市场 "取决于劳动力数据
item.description: 投资者都在关注美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔今天上午在杰克逊霍尔研讨会上的讲话。但摩根士丹利的迈克尔-威尔逊（Michael Wilson）认为，9月初的就业数据将更为重要。【原文：Investors have their eyes peeled on Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s speech at the Jackson Hole symposium this morning. But to Morgan Stanley’s Michael Wilson, the jobs data in early September will be of even bigger importance.】

item.title: 投资者因哈萨克斯坦铀矿生产前景而涌入铀矿企业
item.description: 在世界最大的铀生产商 Kazatomprom 发布了低于市场预期的指导之后，北美以铀为重点的投资者纷纷涌入核反应堆燃料的开采商。【原文：Uranium-focused investors in North America are plowing into in miners of the nuclear reactor fuel after the world’s largest producer, Kazatomprom released guidance that fell short of market expectations.】

item.title: 调查人员将重点转向贝叶斯豪华游艇的沉没原因
item.description: 在为期一周的搜救任务结束后，意大利和英国当局正将重点转移到贝叶斯号豪华游艇如何在西西里海岸如此迅速地沉没。【原文：Following the end of a week-long search and rescue mission, Italian and British authorities are shifting their focus to how the Bayesian luxury yacht sank so quickly off the coast of Sicily.】

item.title: 高盛下调印度 2024 年和 2025 年 GDP 增长预测
item.description: 高盛集团以中央政府开支缩减为由，将印度今明两年的经济增长预期分别下调了 20 个基点。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has lowered India’s growth forecast by 20 basis points each for this year and the next, citing a contraction in central government expenditure.】

item.title: 中国移动收购华为智能手机分拆公司荣耀的股份
item.description: 中国移动通信集团公司的母公司投资了荣耀设备有限公司（Honor Device Co.【原文：The parent of China Mobile Ltd. has invested in Honor Device Co., a big boost for a fast-expanding smartphone brand that was spun out of Huawei Technologies Co. just four years ago.】

item.title: 台湾银行收购战白热化，新光竞购再起波澜
item.description: 台湾 CTBC 金融控股公司（CTBC Financial Holding Co.【原文：Taiwan’s CTBC Financial Holding Co. upped the ante in its bid to acquire Shin Kong Financial Holding Co., with an offer for a controlling stake in its rival that would make it the island’s biggest bank and financial holding firm.】

item.title: 巴西计划帮助中型企业进入债务和股票市场
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）正在制定一项计划，为中型企业提供更多进入该国资本市场的机会，这是巴西促进经济增长努力的一部分。【原文：Brazil is sketching out a plan to provide mid-sized companies with better access to the country’s capital markets, part of an effort by President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva to bolster growth.】

item.title: 伦元反弹，汇市最大空头押注面临考验
item.description: 交易员们对卢比下了创纪录的赌注，押注加拿大经济的迅速放缓和央行的鸽派态度将加深卢比在 2024 年的跌势。【原文：Traders have piled into record wagers against the loonie, betting that a rapidly slowing Canadian economy and a dovish central bank will deepen the currency’s 2024 decline.】

item.title: 津巴布韦下令为基于美元的商品交易所颁发贸易许可证
item.description: 津巴布韦证券交易所运营商负责人表示，津巴布韦计划在今年最后一个季度开始在其唯一一家以美元为基础的证券交易所进行商品交易，并要求所有此类活动都必须获得许可证。【原文：Zimbabwe plans to start trading commodities at its only dollar-based equities exchange in the final quarter of this year, and will require licenses for all such activities, the head of the bourse’s operator said.】

item.title: 德国在寻找买家之际再次延长俄罗斯石油公司托管期
item.description: 德国可能第四次延长对俄罗斯国家能源巨头俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft PJSC）当地子公司的托管期，以便给莫斯科更多时间出售被查封的实体。【原文：Germany is likely to extend its trusteeship over the local subsidiaries of Russia’s state energy giant Rosneft PJSC for a fourth time in order to give Moscow more time for the sale of the seized entity.】

item.title: Eskom 主席称电动汽车站不会导致燃煤汽车的出现
item.description: 南非 Eskom Holdings SOC 有限公司董事长表示，该公司推出的电动汽车和充电站不会导致汽车最终由煤炭驱动，尽管这种最脏的化石燃料在其发电能力中占主导地位。【原文：Electric vehicles and charging stations rolled out by South Africa’s Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. will not result in cars that are ultimately powered by coal, even though the dirtiest fossil fuel dominates its generation capacity, according to the company’s chairman.】

item.title: 瑞银分析师称梅尔罗斯的 "现金山 "并没有那么大
item.description: 据瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）的分析师称，被梅尔罗斯工业公司（Melrose Industries Plc）称为 "现金山 "的喷气发动机业务的价值实际上只有这家英国航空航天工程师公司管理层估计的一半左右。【原文：A jet-engine business described by Melrose Industries Plc as a “cash mountain” is actually worth about half the estimate by the UK aerospace engineer’s management, according to analysts at UBS Group AG.】
